doc.repnme: Transcript of oral history interview with Julian Grenfell held on July 15, 1986
doc.abstracts: In July 1986, Julian Grenfell was interviewed on behalf of the World Bank Group Archives oral history program by Robert W. Oliver. During his tenure at the Bank from 1965 to 1995, Mr. Grenfell worked in the following areas: in the office of information as speech writer (1965-1968); in the information and public affairs department, Afro-Asian division, as chief (1968-1969); in the information and public affairs department, European office, as chief (1969-1970) and as deputy director (1973-1975); in the development services department as assistant director (1970-1973); in the international relations department as special representative to the United Nations (1975-1983); in the information and public affairs department as speech writer(1983-1987); in the external affairs department as senior advisor (1987-1990), as chief of the European division (1990-1995), and as senior advisor to the office of the president (1995). His transcript concerns George Wood, Robert McNamara, devaluation in India, and pre-investment and investment surveys.
